alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:31AM PST until December 07 at 2:19AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Thurston and Grays Harbor Counties. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The upper reaches of the Chehalis River crested overnight. The flood crest will move downstream reaching Grand Mound tonight and Porter on Thursday. The Newaukum River will crest this morning with the river dropping back below flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Newaukum River near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 202.5 feet, flood waters will inundate many roads and residential and commercial areas along the Newaukum River and its forks. Flooding in some areas may be deep and hazardous especially near rivers. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include Jackson Hwy. and Tune, Rush, Sommerville, Griel, Hamilton, Tauscher, Guerrier, Kirkland, Macomber, Rice, Senn, Lucas Creek, Middle Fork and North Fork Roads. A stage of 202.5 feet on the Newaukum roughly corresponds to Phase 2 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 203.9 feet. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting now around 204 feet. The river will begin receding this afternoon and fall below flood stage tonight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
